1.name: Solar Panel
1.description: Captures solar energy and converts it into electrical energy.

embodiment.description: Monocrystalline silicon panels for higher efficiency.

physics_models.name: Power Generation
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_power(efficiency, area, irradiance):
    return efficiency * area * irradiance
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_power(efficiency, area, irradiance):
    return efficiency * area * irradiance
physics_models.coder_notes: Calculates power output based on efficiency, area, and irradiance.

1.verification_plan: Test under varying irradiance conditions to ensure power output meets requirements.

2.name: Battery Storage
2.description: Stores excess energy for use during low-light conditions.

embodiment.description: Provides reliable and cost-effective energy storage.

physics_models.name: Energy Storage
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_energy(capacity, voltage):
    return capacity * voltage
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_energy(capacity, voltage):
    return capacity * voltage
physics_models.coder_notes: Calculates stored energy based on capacity and voltage.

2.verification_plan: Test battery capacity and discharge rate under various environmental conditions.

3.name: Power Management Unit
3.description: Regulates and manages power distribution between solar panels and battery storage.

embodiment.description: Efficiently manages power flow to maximize energy storage.

physics_models.name: Power Regulation
physics_models.coding_directives:
def calculate_output_power(input_power, efficiency):
    return input_power * efficiency
physics_models.python_code:
def calculate_output_power(input_power, efficiency):
    return input_power * efficiency
physics_models.coder_notes: Calculates regulated power output based on input power and efficiency.
assumptions: Input power is stable and within operating range.

3.verification_plan: Test efficiency and stability under varying loads and environmental conditions.
